p: The next step of the research focused on perfume release characterizations. As evidenced by Figure 8, the n-Ï€* band was mostly centered on the blue-green light region, therefore it was expected that the irradiation with blue-green light results in a large fraction of the Z isomer, and thus in a more efficient release of the encapsulated core. However, our recently generated results on visible-light triggered nanocapsules based on the same ortho-substituted azobenzene moiety [ 43] put into evidence that a higher amount of released active was achieved upon visible/white light irradiation than within green light. For this reason, during current studies, visible light was used for perfume release investigations.
